title: What is the Best Way to Learn a New Programming Language in 2026
description: The fastest way to learn a new programming language today is to recreate the apprentice model using AI as a tireless mentor, while you stay responsible for understanding, intent, and correctness.

title: You Donât Need to Be a Supergenius to Build AI Products That Matter
description: Most people wonât train models, but the real leverage in AI comes from knowing when to use it, how to shape it, and how to keep it useful instead of noisy.

title: AI Will Not Transform Industries. People Will.
description: AI scales through infrastructure and data, but real breakthroughs come from individuals who know where to apply it.

title: 2025 Through a Fresh Grad's Eyes: Signals, Noise, and What Actually Matters
description: 2025, a big year for AI that exposed who can think clearly, who can adapt, and who is letting the tools think for them.

title: AI Helped Plan My Trip. It Doesn't Understand Time Zones Either.
description: AI can sketch the trip you want, but still struggles with the human aspects.

title: AI Is the Social Media for Engineering
description: AI can either compound your understanding or quietly erode it, depending on whether you treat it like a tool or a feed.

title: Why Physical Health Matters for Software Engineers
description: Research is clear: software engineers who stay active live longer, think better, and avoid letting their job quietly destroy their health.

title: 10 Systems Design Concepts I Wish I'd Learned Before Senior Year
description: A clear, foundational look at the systems design concepts most students never learn but every real-world engineer eventually relies on.

title: Is Leetcode dead?
description: As AI floods the industry, do Leetcode problems become obsolete or more important than ever?

title: How I Use AI as a Computer Science Student
description: I use AI as a multiplier on my work, not a replacement for it, letting simple tools handle the clutter so I can focus on actually learning and building.

title: Guide to Networking for New Grads in 2025
description: Most students grind LeetCode without realizing the real first step is building genuine connections that open the door to those interviews.

title: Dangers of AI in the Workplace
description: AI won't destroy software engineering, but it will make it obvious who truly understands it.

title: The Most Important Part of Software Development that AI Can't Replace
description: Given its rapid development, it's easy to think that AI will come for just about all aspects of software engineering, but at the very core of software design lies something that AI cannot understand or account for.

title: How AI is Reshaping the Psychology of Software Engineering
description: As AI increasingly takes over lower-level tasks in roles like SWE and consulting, are our brains prepared for this dramatic shift to higher-level thinking?
